p: The small number of positive results in the community sample (n = 15) limited the inclusion of all significant univariable effects in a multivariable model [ 35]. Instead, we focused only the effect of slaughtering animals, with control for the potential confounding effect of age. No further model selection was performed. Increasing age continued to predict seropositivity (OR 1.2 95% CI 1.1–1.4, p <0.001) and there was evidence of the positive effect of slaughtering cattle (OR 3.3; 95% CI 1.0–10.5, p = 0.047) ( Table 2).
